docs.title: RTSP
docs.text:
RTSP (Real-Time Streaming Protocol) is a network protocol used for controlling multimedia streaming over IP networks. It’s like a “remote control” for streaming, allowing clients to interact with a server hosting media.

I will use it to connect the raspberry client to a esp32 host to get a stream using vlc of the board camera.

docs.title: Wifi protocols
docs.text:
dhcp - Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol it's a helper for connecting device's IP adress(its unique ID on the network), DHCP automatically gives each device the information it needs to connect, such as:

  1. IP Address: A unique identifier for your device on the network.
  2. Subnet Mask: Helps the device know which part of the network it belongs to.
  3. Gateway: The "exit point" for your device to communicate with the internet or other networks.
  4. DNS Server: Tells your device how to find websites and other services online.

When you connect a device (like a phone or laptop) to Wi-Fi, it asks the DHCP server, "What settings do I need?" The DHCP server quickly replies with the details, and your device is ready to go.

Think of it as a hotel receptionist giving guests their room keys and directions without any hassle!

docs.title: Rasberrypi_esp32
docs.text:
source

setting up ssh on raspbery pi

usually comes with ssh, if not use this 

sudo apt update
sudo apt install openssh-server

Verify status is on 

sudo systemctl status sshd

#find the raspberry pi's ip adress
hostname -I
#This will show the Raspberry Pi's local IP address, e.g., 192.168.1.100

docs.title: set up
docs.text:
First thing is getting the raspberryPi imager' because it's the easiest way to get the img.

next thing I want to do is decide which img I need server/desktop, depnds on the project.

using the setting in the imager i can get the ssh and wi fi time zone .. insead of using the wizard.
